question: 1. What does HTML stand for?
improvement: HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language, a standard for creating web pages.

question: 2. Who is making the Web standards?
improvement: The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) develops web standards, including HTML.

question: 3. Choose the correct HTML element for the largest heading:
improvement: The <h1> tag represents the largest heading in HTML.

question: 4. What is the correct HTML element for inserting a line break?
improvement:
The
tag is used for inserting a line break in HTML.

question: 5. What is the correct HTML for adding a background color?
improvement: Use inline styles, like 'style="background-color:yellow;"', for quick background customization.

question: 6. Choose the correct HTML element to define important text
improvement: Use <strong> for semantically important text.

question: 7. Choose the correct HTML element to define emphasized text
improvement: <em> is the correct tag for emphasizing text.

question: 8. What is the correct HTML for creating a hyperlink?
improvement: To create hyperlinks, always use <a href=""> for proper linking.

question: 9. Which character is used to indicate an end tag?
improvement: The '/' character indicates the end of an HTML tag.

question: 10. How can you open a link in a new tab/browser window?
improvement: Use 'target="_blank"' in the <a> tag to open links in a new tab.

question: 11. Which of these elements are all <table> elements?
improvement: The <table> tag pairs with <tr> and <td> to define table rows and cells.

question: 12. Inline elements are normally displayed without starting a new line.
improvement: Inline elements do not break onto a new line, unlike block elements.

question: 13. How can you make a numbered list?
improvement: The <ol> tag creates an ordered (numbered) list in HTML.

question: 14. How can you make a bulleted list?
improvement: The <ul> tag is used to create unordered (bulleted) lists.

question: 15. What is the correct HTML for making a checkbox?
improvement: Checkboxes are created using <input type="checkbox">.

question: 16. What is the correct HTML for making a text input field?
improvement: The <input type="text"> tag is used for text input fields.

question: 17. What is the correct HTML for making a drop-down list?
improvement: Dropdown lists are created using the <select> tag.

question: 18. What is the correct HTML for making a text area?
improvement: Text areas for multiline text input use the <textarea> tag.

question: 19. What is the correct HTML for inserting an image?
improvement: Images are inserted using .

question: 20. What is the correct HTML for inserting a background image?
improvement: Background images are set using inline styles with 'background-image:url()'.

question: 21. An <iframe> is used to display a web page within a web page.
answers: 2. There is no such thing as an <iframe>
improvement: An <iframe> displays a web page inside another web page.

question: 22. HTML comments start with <!-- and end with -->
improvement: HTML comments start with <!-- and end with -->.

question: 23. Block elements are normally displayed without starting a new line.
improvement: Block elements always start on a new line.

question: 24. Which HTML element defines the title of a document?
improvement: The <title> tag defines the document's title, shown in the browser tab.

question: 25. Which HTML attribute specifies an alternate text for an image, if the image cannot be displayed?
improvement: The 'alt' attribute specifies alternative text for images if they can't load.

question: 26. Which doctype is correct for HTML5?
improvement: The correct doctype declaration for HTML5 is <!DOCTYPE html>.

question: 27. Which HTML element is used to specify a footer for a document or section?
improvement: The <footer> tag specifies a footer for a document or section.
